Channel equalization and maximum likelihood sequence estimation. Channel precoding and pre-equalization. OFDM and transmit diversity. Array processing.

EEC 262.title: Multi-access Communications Theory
EEC 262.description: Maximum stable throughput of Poisson collision channels. Classic collision resolution algorithms. Carrier sensing multiple access and its performance analysis. System stability analysis. Joint design of the physical/medium access control layers. Capacity region of multi-access channels. Multi-access with correlated sources.

EEC 263.title: Optimal & Adaptive Filtering
EEC 263.description: Geometric formulation of least-squares estimation problems. Theory and applications of optimum Wiener and Kalman filtering. MAP and maximum likelihood estimation of hidden Markov models, Viterbi algorithm. Adaptive filtering algorithms, properties and applications.

EEC 264.title: Estimation & Detection of Signals in Noise
EEC 264.description: Introduction to parameter estimation and detections of signals in noise. Bayes and Neyman-Pearson likelihood-ratio tests for signal detection. Maximum-likelihood parameter estimation. Detection of known and Gaussian signals in white or colored noise. Applications to communications, radar, signal processing.

EEC 265.title: Principles of Digital Communications
EEC 265.description: Introduction to digital communications. Coding for analog sources. Characterization of signals and systems. Modulation and demodulation for the additive Gaussian channel. Digital signaling over bandwidth-constrained linear filter channels and over fading multipath channels. Spread spectrum signals.

EEC 266.title: Information Theory & Coding
EEC 266.description: Topics include Entropy, Relatively Entropy, Mutual Information; Asymptotic Equipartition Property; Entropy Rates of Stochastic Process; Data Compression; Channel Capacity; Differential Entropy; Gaussian Channel; Rate Distortion Theory; Network Information Theory.

EEC 267.title: Mobile Communications
EEC 267.description: Time-varying multi-path fading channel models and receiver performance in fading channels; multiple access techniques and multiple access receivers design and performance; optimum design and the capacity of wireless channels.

EEC 269A.title: Error Correcting Codes: Algebraic Approach
EEC 269A.description: Introduction to theory and practice of block codes, linear block codes, cyclic codes, decoding algorithms, and coding techniques.

EEC 269B.title: Error Correcting Codes: Probabilistic Approach
EEC 269B.description: Probabilistic approach to construct and decode error-correcting codes, coded communication systems, low-density parity-check (LDPC) codes, polar codes, fountain codes, decoding algorithms.

EEC 270.title: Computer Architecture
EEC 270.description: Introduction to modern techniques for high-performance single and multiple processor systems. Topics include advanced pipeline design, advanced memory hierarchy design, optimizing pipeline and memory use, and memory sharing among multiprocessors. Case studies of recent single and multiple processor systems.

EEC 272.title: High-Performance Computer Architecture
EEC 272.description: Designing and analysis of high performance computer architecture with emphasis on vector processing, on-chip interconnect networks, chip-level multiprocessors, memory and storage subsystem design and impact of technological advances on computer architecture.

EEC 273.title: Networking Architecture & Resource Management
EEC 273.description: Design & implementation principles of networking architecture and protocols. Internet, data center, and telephony case studies. Topics: Internet data & control planes; application & services; resource management; Quality of Service (QoS) provisioning; traffic engineering; performance evaluation, software-defined networks, & future research issues.

EEC 275.title: Introduction to Hardware Security
EEC 275.description: Hardware Security. Cryptographic processing and the analysis of its overhead, physical attacks, side-channel attacks and counter measures, physically unclonable functions, hardware-based random number generators, watermarking of Intellectual Property blocks, field-programmable gate array security, printed circuit board security, passive and active metering for prevention of piracy, and access control.

EEC 279.title: Modern Parallel Computing
EEC 279.description: Exploration of the architecture of modern parallel computers, their programming models, and their programming systems.

EEC 281.title: VLSI Digital Signal Processing
EEC 281.description: Digital signal processors, building blocks, and algorithms. Design and implementation of processor algorithms, architectures, control, functional units, and circuit topologies for increased performance and reduced circuit size and power dissipation.

EEC 283.title: Advanced Design Verification of Digital Systems
EEC 283.description: Design verification techniques for digital systems; simulation-based design verification techniques; formal verification techniques, including equivalence checking, model checking, and theorem proving; timing analysis and verification; application of design cerification techniques to microprocessors.

EEC 284.title: Design & Optimization of Embedded Computing Systems
EEC 284.description: Introduction to design and optimization of digital computing systems for embedded applications. Topics include combinatorial optimization techniques, performance and energy optimization in embedded systems, compilation and architecture-specific mapping, programmable and reconfigurable platforms; design automation and algorithmic improvements to design process.

EEC 286.title: Introduction to Digital System Testing
EEC 286.description: Review of several current techniques used to detect physical faults in both combinational and sequential circuits. Topics include fault modeling, fault simulation, test generation, compression techniques, and testing architectures.

EEC 289A.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Computer Science

EEC 289B.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Programming Systems

EEC 289C.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Digital Systems

EEC 289D.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Digital Systems

EEC 289E.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Signal Transmission

EEC 289F.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Digital Communication

EEC 289G.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Control Systems

EEC 289H.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Robotics

EEC 289I.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Signal Processing

EEC 289J.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Image Processing

EEC 289K.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: High Frequency Phenomena & Devices
EEC 289K.description: Special topics in High Frequency Phenomena & Devices.

EEC 289L.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Solid-State Devices & Physical Electronics
EEC 289L.description: Special topics in Solid-State Devices & Physical Electronics.

EEC 289M.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Systems Theory

EEC 289N.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Active & Passive Circuits
EEC 289N.description: Special topics in Active & Passive Circuits.

EEC 289O.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Integrated Circuits

EEC 289P.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Computer Software

EEC 289Q.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Computer Engineering

EEC 289R.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Microprocessing

EEC 289S.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Electronics

EEC 289T.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Electromagnetics

EEC 289U.title: Special Topics in Electrical & Computer Engineering: Optoelectronics

EEC 289W.title: Special Topics in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science: Computer Networks

EEC 290.title: Seminar in Electrical & Computer Engineering
EEC 290.description: Discussion and presentation of current research and development in Electrical & Computer Engineering.

EEC 290C.title: Graduate Research Group Conference in Electrical & Computer Engineering
EEC 290C.description: Research problems, progress, and techniques in electrical and computer engineering.

EEC 290P.title: Capstone Project For MS Plan II
EEC 290P.description: Conducting research projects in electrical and computer engineering. Communicating research results in written reports and oral presentations. Systemic project implementation to answer a comprehensive scientific or technical question in the area of electrical and computer engineering.

EEC 291.title: Solid-State Circuit Research Laboratory Seminar
EEC 291.description: Lectures on solid-state circuit and system design by various visiting experts in the field.

EEC 292.title: Seminar in Solid-State Technology
EEC 292.description: Lectures on solid-state technology by various visiting experts in the field.

EEC 293.title: Computer Engineering Research Seminar
EEC 293.description: Lectures, tutorials and seminars on topics in computer engineering.

EEC 294.title: Communications, Signal & Image Processing Seminar
EEC 294.description: Communications, signal and image processing, video engineering and computer vision.

EEC 295.title: Systems, Control & Robotics Seminar
EEC 295.description: Seminars on current research in systems and control by faculty and visiting experts. Technical presentations and lectures on current topics in robotics research and robotics technology.

EEC 296.title: Photonics Research Seminar
EEC 296.description: Lectures on photonics and related areas by faculty and visiting experts.

EEC 390.title: The Teaching of Electrical Engineering
EEC 390.description: Participation as a teaching assistant or associate-in in a designated engineering course. Methods of leading discussion groups or laboratory sections, writing and grading quizzes, use of laboratory equipment, and grading laboratory reports.
